intro: Thlaspi fendleri var. hesperium, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its yellow or orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
